dmca_clarifications:  I would like to provide some additional information.  
In all of the above listed applications, we do not make use of these  
trademarked phrases within our application. We also do not make use of any  
officially trademarked logos within our application. In the market  
descriptions, we do reference these trademarked names. We do this to help  
the buyer identify that the app is convenient and helpful to the fans of  
these teams. The second time we use it is to clearly state that we are not  
affiliated. We do this because we do not want to confuse the buyer. We do  
not use the logo as an official app would. We do not say we are official.  
Actually we state the fact that we are not affiliated, and we name the  
organization by trademark, to validate that we are clearly not associated  
with them. Inside the app we do not use their trademarked name at all. Our  
app is convenient way for a user to quickly link to websites and other  
content that might interest a fan of these teams. We are not in competition  
with their official apps, if they even have one, nor are we trying  
to "confuse" the customer into thinking we are. We would actually be open  
to any suggestions that would allow us to continue to satisfy our  
customers, while also ensuring no legal issues. Most of our content is  
content that cannot be found on the official websites, or news that the is  
not provided by the official sources. We have plans to add a chat mechanism  
to allow these "people of a similar interest", aka fans, to be able to post  
messages and pictures with other users. This is yet another item that is  
not an option on the official application or resources provided to their  
fans. I would like to clarify this point: If this is not legal, then I  
don't want anything to do with it. I am an extremely hard working  
programmer that has dedicated 1000's of hours to getting my apps out on the  
appmarket, and I want to make money fair and square, period. So I don't  
want to pursue improving my apps if they are just going to be taken off the  
market as soon as some organization feels that my 3 sales a week @1.49 is  
somehow hurting their market and profits. If my phrasing in my descriptions  
needs to be changed, I will do that. If my use of part of the trademarked  
phrase is in violation, I will change the name. I can not make it clear  
enough that I do not want to make a profit off of some else's hard work,  
and I have not. I have earned this money by providing for fans of these  
organizations what they cannot themselves provide. These organizations only  
publish "Happy News". Their fans want ALL news available. I have even seen  
comments reflecting that these official apps, "Only provided the same  
content as their website". This is insulting to the fans, they deserve  
better. I would like to be official, maybe someone can redirect me to whom  
I shall contact, but if I am not aloud to show 3rd party (unofficial) news,  
I would not be interested, as this is why I created these apps. I noticed  
that I am going to check a box below that states: "or that the material  
identified by the complainant has been removed or disabled and will no  
longer be shown." If for some reason it is decided that my apps are indeed  
in violation, I would like an opportunity to have them unpublished so I can  
removed the content that is in violation and republish the app. Thank you  
so much for taking the time to help me with this.
